verses.kjv: Moreover the spirit lifted me up, and brought me unto the east gate of the LORD’s house, which looketh eastward: and behold at the door of the gate five and twenty men; among whom I saw Jaazaniah the son of Azur, and Pelatiah the son of Benaiah, princes of the people.
verses.web: Moreover the Spirit lifted me up, and brought me to the east gate of LORD’s house, which looks eastward. Behold, twenty-five men were at the door of the gate; and I saw among them Jaazaniah the son of Azzur, and Pelatiah the son of Benaiah, princes of the people.
verses.ct: Then the Spirit lifted me up and carried me to the east gate of the LORD's house — the one facing east. There at the entrance of the gate stood 25 men. Among them I recognized Jaazaniah son of Azur and Pelatiah son of Benaiah, both leaders of the people.

verses.kjv: Then said he unto me, Son of man, these are the men that devise mischief, and give wicked counsel in this city:
verses.web: He said to me, “Son of man, these are the men who devise iniquity, and who give wicked counsel in this city;
verses.ct: God said to me, "Son of man, these are the men who plot evil and give wicked advice in this city.

verses.kjv: Which say, It is not near; let us build houses: this city is the caldron, and we be the flesh.
verses.web: who say, ‘The time is not near to build houses. This is the cauldron, and we are the meat.’
verses.ct: They say, 'Destruction isn't coming anytime soon. Let's build houses! This city is the cooking pot, and we are the choice meat inside it — safe and protected.'

verses.kjv: Therefore prophesy against them, prophesy, O son of man.
verses.web: Therefore prophesy against them. Prophesy, son of man.”
verses.ct: So prophesy against them. Prophesy, son of man!"

verses.kjv: And the Spirit of the LORD fell upon me, and said unto me, Speak; Thus saith the LORD; Thus have ye said, O house of Israel: for I know the things that come into your mind, every one of them.
verses.web: LORD’s Spirit fell on me, and he said to me, “Speak, ‘LORD says: “Thus you have said, house of Israel; for I know the things that come into your mind.
verses.ct: The Spirit of the LORD fell on me and told me to speak: "This is what the LORD says: That is what you've been saying, people of Israel. I know every thought that enters your minds.

verses.kjv: Ye have multiplied your slain in this city, and ye have filled the streets thereof with the slain.
verses.web: You have multiplied your slain in this city, and you have filled its streets with the slain.
verses.ct: You have killed so many in this city that you've filled its streets with the dead.

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD; Your slain whom ye have laid in the midst of it, they are the flesh, and this city is the caldron: but I will bring you forth out of the midst of it.
verses.web: “ ‘Therefore the Lord LORD says: “Your slain whom you have laid in the middle of it, they are the meat, and this is the cauldron; but you will be brought out of the middle of it.
verses.ct: So this is what the Lord GOD says: The people you slaughtered and left lying in the streets — they are the meat, and this city is the pot. But as for you, I will drag you out of it.

verses.kjv: Ye have feared the sword; and I will bring a sword upon you, saith the Lord GOD.
verses.web: You have feared the sword; and I will bring the sword on you,” says the Lord LORD.
verses.ct: You have feared the sword, and the sword is exactly what I will bring against you," declares the Lord GOD.

verses.kjv: And I will bring you out of the midst thereof, and deliver you into the hands of strangers, and will execute judgments among you.
verses.web: “I will bring you out of the middle of it, and deliver you into the hands of strangers, and will execute judgments among you.
verses.ct: "I will pull you out of this city and hand you over to foreigners, and I will carry out my judgment against you.

verses.kjv: Ye shall fall by the sword; I will judge you in the border of Israel; and ye shall know that I am the LORD.
verses.web: You will fall by the sword. I will judge you in the border of Israel. Then you will know that I am LORD.
verses.ct: You will die by the sword. I will judge you at the borders of Israel. Then you will know that I am the LORD.

verses.kjv: This city shall not be your caldron, neither shall ye be the flesh in the midst thereof; but I will judge you in the border of Israel:
verses.web: This will not be your cauldron, neither will you be the meat in the middle of it. I will judge you in the border of Israel.
verses.ct: This city will not be your protective pot, and you will not be the safe meat inside it. I will judge you at the borders of Israel.

verses.kjv: And ye shall know that I am the LORD: for ye have not walked in my statutes, neither executed my judgments, but have done after the manners of the heathen that are round about you.
verses.web: You will know that I am LORD, for you have not walked in my statutes, You have not executed my ordinances, but have done after the ordinances of the nations that are around you.” ’ ”
verses.ct: Then you will know that I am the LORD — because you refused to follow my laws and obey my commands. Instead, you adopted the practices of the nations around you."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when I prophesied, that Pelatiah the son of Benaiah died. Then fell I down upon my face, and cried with a loud voice, and said, Ah Lord GOD! wilt thou make a full end of the remnant of Israel?
verses.web: When I prophesied, Pelatiah the son of Benaiah died. Then I fell down on my face, and cried with a loud voice, and said, “Ah Lord LORD! Will you make a full end of the remnant of Israel?”
verses.ct: While I was prophesying, Pelatiah son of Benaiah dropped dead. I fell facedown and cried out in a loud voice, "Oh, Lord GOD! Are you going to completely destroy what's left of Israel?"

verses.kjv: Again the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
verses.web: LORD’s word came to me, saying,
verses.ct: Then the word of the LORD came to me:

verses.kjv: Son of man, thy brethren, even thy brethren, the men of thy kindred, and all the house of Israel wholly, are they unto whom the inhabitants of Jerusalem have said, Get you far from the LORD: unto us is this land given in possession.
verses.web: “Son of man, your brothers, even your brothers, the men of your relatives, and all the house of Israel, all of them, are they to whom the inhabitants of Jerusalem have said, ‘Go far away from LORD. This land has been given to us for a possession.’ ”
verses.ct: "Son of man, your own relatives — your fellow exiles and all the rest of the house of Israel — these are the people about whom the residents of Jerusalem have said, 'They've been sent far away from the LORD. This land has been given to us now.'

verses.kjv: Therefore say, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Although I have cast them far off among the heathen, and although I have scattered them among the countries, yet will I be to them as a little sanctuary in the countries where they shall come.
verses.web: “Therefore say, ‘The Lord LORD says: “Whereas I have removed them far off among the nations, and whereas I have scattered them among the countries, yet I will be to them a sanctuary for a little while in the countries where they have come.” ’
verses.ct: So tell them this: The Lord GOD says, 'Yes, I sent them far away among the nations and scattered them across foreign lands. But even there, I have been a sanctuary for them in the countries where they've gone.'

verses.kjv: Therefore say, Thus saith the Lord GOD; I will even gather you from the people, and assemble you out of the countries where ye have been scattered, and I will give you the land of Israel.
verses.web: “Therefore say, ‘The Lord LORD says: “I will gather you from the peoples, and assemble you out of the countries where you have been scattered, and I will give you the land of Israel.”
verses.ct: Then say this: The Lord GOD says, 'I will gather you from the nations and bring you back from the countries where you've been scattered, and I will give you the land of Israel again.'

verses.kjv: And they shall come thither, and they shall take away all the detestable things thereof and all the abominations thereof from thence.
verses.web: “ ‘They will come there, and they will take away all its detestable things and all its abominations from there.
verses.ct: When they return, they will remove every disgusting idol and every detestable thing from the land.

verses.kjv: And I will give them one heart, and I will put a new spirit within you; and I will take the stony heart out of their flesh, and will give them an heart of flesh:
verses.web: I will give them one heart, and I will put a new spirit within you. I will take the stony heart out of their flesh, and will give them a heart of flesh;
verses.ct: I will give them a united heart and put a new spirit within them. I will take out their stubborn heart of stone and give them a responsive heart of flesh.

verses.kjv: That they may walk in my statutes, and keep mine ordinances, and do them: and they shall be my people, and I will be their God.
verses.web: that they may walk in my statutes, and keep my ordinances, and do them. They will be my people, and I will be their God.
verses.ct: Then they will follow my laws and carefully obey my commands. They will be my people, and I will be their God.

verses.kjv: But as for them whose heart walketh after the heart of their detestable things and their abominations, I will recompense their way upon their own heads, saith the Lord GOD.
verses.web: But as for them whose heart walks after the heart of their detestable things and their abominations, I will bring their way on their own heads,’ says the Lord LORD.”
verses.ct: But for those whose hearts chase after their disgusting idols and detestable practices — I will bring the consequences of their actions down on their own heads," declares the Lord GOD.

verses.kjv: Then did the cherubims lift up their wings, and the wheels beside them; and the glory of the God of Israel was over them above.
verses.web: Then the cherubim lifted up their wings, and the wheels were beside them. The glory of the God of Israel was over them above.
verses.ct: Then the cherubim spread their wings, with the wheels moving beside them, and the glory of the God of Israel hovered above them.

verses.kjv: And the glory of the LORD went up from the midst of the city, and stood upon the mountain which is on the east side of the city.
verses.web: LORD’s glory went up from the middle of the city, and stood on the mountain which is on the east side of the city.
verses.ct: The glory of the LORD rose up from the middle of the city and came to rest on the mountain east of Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Afterwards the spirit took me up, and brought me in a vision by the Spirit of God into Chaldea, to them of the captivity. So the vision that I had seen went up from me.
verses.web: The Spirit lifted me up, and brought me in the vision by the Spirit of God into Chaldea, to the captives. So the vision that I had seen went up from me.
verses.ct: After that, the Spirit lifted me up and carried me back in a vision — by the Spirit of God — to the exiles in Chaldea. Then the vision I had seen faded away.

verses.kjv: Then I spake unto them of the captivity all the things that the LORD had shewed me.
verses.web: Then I spoke to the captives all the things that LORD had shown me.
verses.ct: I told the exiles everything the LORD had shown me.
